member.name: M:SG.Crypto.MD4.engineUpdate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)

count of bytes in input blcok to consider

member.name: M:SG.Shapes.Property.List.IsForEachPropertyList(SG.Shapes.IPropertiesRange,System.Predicate{SG.Shapes.Property.List})

summary.para: Calls a predicate delegate for each Property.List in a properties range. If predicate returns false, the loop is broken regardless of whether all properties have been iterated.
This method is intended for use in API get methods. If it is called by a set method, the calling method or the delegate is reponsible for calling OnPropertiesChanged().

member.param: a properties range
a predicate delegate
member.returns: the last value returned by predicate

member.name: M:SG.Shapes.Property.List.IsForEachFillProperties(SG.Shapes.IPropertiesRange,System.Boolean,System.Predicate{SG.Shapes.FillProperties})

summary.para: Calls a predicate delegate for each FillProperties in a properties range. If predicate returns false, the loop is broken regardless of whether all properties have been iterated.
This method is intended for use in API get methods. If it is called by a set method, the calling method or the delegate is reponsible for calling OnPropertiesChanged().

member.param: a properties range
true to iterate outline fill properties, false to iterate interior fill properties
a predicate delegate
member.returns: the last value returned by predicate

member.name: M:SG.Shapes.Property.List.ForEachFillProperties(SG.Shapes.IPropertiesRange,System.Boolean,System.Action{SG.Shapes.FillProperties})

summary.para: Calls an action delegate for each FillProperties in a properties range.
This method is intended for use in API set methods, and it calls OnPropertiesChanged() on each FillProperties. It should not be used by API get methods.

member.param: a properties range
true to iterate outline fill properties, false to iterate interior fill properties
an action delegate

summary.para: This Value structure greatly simplifies (and probably speeds up) the case where someone needs to get a brush, but does not normally use a GraphicsPath. It allows the GetBrush() methods to accept an implicitly cast rectangle or point array, while avoiding heap or GDI overhead except when absolutely required.

Of course, any method may accept a PathInfo.Value structure as GetBrush() does, but if multiple methods end up working this way, the caller will need to bear in mind the cost of potentially creating and disposing identical GraphicsPath objects in each of those methods.

A method that accepts an argument of type PathInfo.Value must, if it gets the Path or GradientPath properties, subsequently call the Dipose() method. The using statement cannot be used here because of the way it is implemented for structs.

summary.para: At least two properties must be explicitly set to form a valid triangle. When getting a property that has not been explicitly set, an assertion is raised if there are not at least two explictly set properties.

member.name: T:SG.SS.Worksheet.RangeImpl.State
member.summary: Provides the ability to save the state of the cells/rows/columns referred to by an IRange - see remarks for usage information.

remarks.para: To save the state, create an instance of State and pass the IRange and appropriate flags.
To Restore from the State (Undo), call State.Restore() which will dispose of the object after restoring.
You must call Dispose() to release potentially unused resources in the workbook when finished with an instance of State.

member.name: M:SG.SS.Hashable`1.List.ForEachUnordered(System.Action{`0})
member.summary: Calls action(t) for each item in the hash table in no particular order.

member.name: P:SG.SS.Hashable`1.List.AllowDuplicates
member.summary: Set this property to true if duplicates should be allowed.
member.remarks:
Classes such as Formula.Externsheet must be allowed to change their values and go back in the table. Otherwise, a complete scan of a workbook would be required to replace all references to the externsheet with a new externsheet. When the workbook is written, duplicate entries will indeed be written (no different than pre V4 when we had arrays rather than hashtables). When the workbook is read back in, the duplicates will be removed.
This seems OK since this is actually a rare case.

member.name: M:SG.SS.Hashable`1.List.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Remove the specified item from the hashtable - ignored if item is not in list.
member.param: The item to remove.
member.remarks: This method is forgivin about missing items because it is pretty cheap and saves work in Engine.Remove(T) which has to deal with things which might not be in the list. This behaviour is consistent with .NET Hashtables.

summary.para: Indexable is the base class for lists of objects which must be accessable by index as a file is read, and which must be converted to an index number when a file is written.

Each item in the list keeps a count of how many references there are to it. When the item is first created, this count is left at zero. As references to the object are created, the count is incremented. As references are removed, the count is decremented. When a count is decremented to zero, the item is considered undefined and unusable. This is necessary since the Indexable objects referered to by this item must have there references decremented.

When a new item is needed, MakeItem(Indexable) searches for a matching item in the list with a non-zero count. If a match is not found, an object with a count of zero is reused. If there are no objects to reuse, a new item is added to the list.

member.name: P:SG.SS.Indexable`2.ThisAsT
member.summary: Converts this Indexable(T,P) to T - more than 2x faster than casting.

member.name: M:SG.SS.Indexable`2.List.ForEachOrderedByReferenceCountOrDebugID(System.Action{`0})
member.summary: Calls action(t) for each item in the hash table sorted in descending order by reference count for release builds but in the order they were created in debug builds.

member.name: M:SG.SS.Indexable`2.List.MakeItem(`0)
member.summary: Makes an item equals to srcItem whose parent is this list; creates a copy if srcItem does not belong to this list or just returns srcItem if already belongs to this list.
member.param: The source item which may or may not already belong to this list.
member.returns: A new item which is equal to srcItem and belongs to this list.

member.name: T:SG.Library.BitStruct
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for reading and writing bit fields sequentially as documented in Microsoft's specifications for binary file formats. The use of this structure improves the reliability of code where bit fields are used extensively, by forcing every bit field to be accounted for, in the order documented. It is intended for use only in situations where the performance cost is outweighed by the benefits of accounting for each bit field explicitly and in sequence.

member.name: F:SG.Library.BitStruct.value
member.summary: The bit structure value

member.name: F:SG.Library.BitStruct.size
member.summary: The current size of the bit structure, in bits

member.name: F:SG.Library.BitStruct.offset
member.summary: The current offset into the bit structure (for reading)

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Private constructor for implicit integer-to-bit structure conversions
member.param: integer value
integer size, in bits

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.op_Implicit(System.UInt32)~SG.Library.BitStruct
member.summary: Implicitly convert a UInt32 to a BitStruct

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.op_Implicit(System.UInt16)~SG.Library.BitStruct
member.summary: Implicitly convert a UInt16 to a BitStruct

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.op_Implicit(System.Byte)~SG.Library.BitStruct
member.summary: Implicitly convert a Byte to a BitStruct

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.op_Explicit(SG.Library.BitStruct)~System.UInt32
member.summary: Convert a BitStruct to a UInt32. This conversion requires an explicit cast because it fails if size != 32.

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.op_Explicit(SG.Library.BitStruct)~System.UInt16
member.summary: Convert a BitStruct to a UInt16. This conversion requires an explicit cast because it fails if size != 16.

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.op_Explicit(SG.Library.BitStruct)~System.Byte
member.summary: Convert a BitStruct to a Byte. This conversion requires an explicit cast because it fails if size != 8.

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.ReadUInt32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a specified number of bits starting at offset as a UInt32, and increments offset by that number of bits.
member.param: must be 1..32

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.ReadInt32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a specified number of bits starting at offset as an Int32, and increments offset by that number of bits. Negative numbers of less than 32 bits are padded to maintain the correct value.
member.param: must be 2..32

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.ReadUInt16(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a specified number of bits starting at offset as a UInt16, and increments offset by that number of bits.
member.param: must be 1..16

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.ReadInt16(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a specified number of bits starting at offset as an Int16, and increments offset by that number of bits. Negative numbers of less than 16 bits are padded to maintain the correct value.
member.param: must be 2..16

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.ReadByte(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a specified number of bits starting at offset as a Byte, and increments offset by that number of bits.
member.param: must be 1..8

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.ReadBool(System.Int32)
member.summary: Evaluates a specified number of bits starting at offset as a boolean value, and increments offset by that number of bits. All non-zero values evaluate to true. For 1-bit boolean values, use the overload with no arguments.
member.param: must be 2..32

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.ReadBool
member.summary: Reads a single bit as a boolean value, and increments the offset by 1.

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.Skip(System.Int32)
member.summary: Skips the specified number of bits
member.param: must be 1..32

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.Rewind
member.summary: Sets the offset to 0

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.Write(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes an unsigned value into the specified number of bits starting at size, and increments size by that number of bits.
member.param: a value which must fit in the number of bits specified
must be 1..32

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.Write(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a signed value into the specified number of bits starting at size, and increments size by that number of bits.
member.param: a value which must fit in the number of bits specified
must be 2..32

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.Write(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a boolean value as 1 or 0 into the specified number of bits starting at size, and increments size by that number of bits.
member.param: a boolean value
must be 2..32

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.Write(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a single bit at size as a boolean value, and increments size by 1.
member.param: a boolean value

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.WriteZeroes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the specified number of bits starting at size as 0, and increments size by that number of bits.

member.name: M:SG.Library.BitStruct.Clear
member.summary: Clears the bit structure value, and resets size and offset to 0.

member.name: M:SG.Threading.Worker.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a Worker object which will use one (and only one) system threadpool thread to process a number of jobs sequentially - first in, first out. You MUST call Dispose on this object after you instantiate it, or it will never release the thread pool thread. This class should only be used for multiple jobs within one logical task (such as multiple tasks during the reading of one workbook).

member.name: M:SG.Threading.Worker.QueueJob(SG.Threading.Job)
member.summary: Adds a job to be performed.
member.param: A delegate for the job to be performed.

member.name: M:SG.Threading.Worker.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of this object, ignoring all remaining jobs. Any currently executing job will not be stopped by Worker.

member.name: M:SG.SGMath.MinimizeBrentsMethod(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,SG.SGMath.Function)
member.summary: Finds the value of x which yields the minimum f(x) where a le x le b.
member.param: Minimum value to consider for x.
Maximum value to consider for x.
Stops when movement is less than or equal to epsilon.
The value of x which yields the minimum f(x).
The function to evaluate.
member.remarks: Notation and implementation based on Chapter 5 of Richard Brent's book "Algorithms for Minimization Without Derivatives".
member.returns: The result of f(x) for the value returned in x.

member.name: M:SG.SGMath.ScaleMinMaxForAxis(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Scales min and max so that either min is less or equal to -1 and greater than -10 or max is greater or equal to 1 and less than 10.
member.returns: The exponent to pass into Pow10 to restore the range or min and max - use SG.SS.Pow10(ref x, exp) to scale to the origonal values.

member.summary: Represents a Color in the SpreadsheetGear API.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.ColorIndex
member.summary: ColorIndex provides special constants which specify that a color should be Automatic or None (transparent).
member.remarks: Colors may be specified as indexes into a color palette. ColorIndex.Automatic and ColorIndex.None are special values which may be supplied in place of a normal color index.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.ColorIndex.Automatic
member.summary: Specifies that the color is determined automatically.
member.remarks: In most cases the automatic color for text or an object is obtained from the current system colors. Typically this is the default window text color for text and lines or the default window color to fill a background.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.ColorIndex.None
member.summary: Specifies no color (transparent).
member.remarks: Setting the color of an object to None will cause the object to be transparent.

member.summary: Represents a factory which created a workbook set and all of the objects contained by the workbook set.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.Factory
member.summary: The Factory class provides static methods for creating instances of and .
member.remarks: All methods in Factory are thread safe.

example.code: Module Program Sub Main() ' Create a new empty workbook set. Dim workbookSet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbookSet = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbookSet() ' Create a new empty workbook in the workbook set. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = workbookSet.Workbooks.Add() ' Get a reference to the first worksheet. Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1") ' Get a reference to the top left cell of Sheet1. Dim a1 As SpreadsheetGear.IRange = worksheet.Cells("A1") ' Set a formula. a1.Formula = "=24901.55 / PI()" ' Output the result of the formula. Console.WriteLine(("The diameter of the earth is " + a1.Value.ToString() + " miles.")) End Sub End Module

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook
member.summary: Creates an instance of in a new instance of .

remarks.para: This method is thread safe.
The workbook set containing the new workbook will use the US English CultureInfo. To create a workbook in a workbook set with a specific culture, use .

example.code: Module Program Sub Main() ' Create a new empty workbook in a new workbook set. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook() ' Get a reference to the first worksheet. Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1") ' Get a reference to the top left cell of Sheet1. Dim a1 As SpreadsheetGear.IRange = worksheet.Cells("A1") ' Set a formula. a1.Formula = "=24901.55 / PI()" ' Output the result of the formula. Console.WriteLine(("The diameter of the earth is " + a1.Value.ToString() + " miles.")) End Sub End Module

member.returns: A new instance of in a new instance of .

example.code: Module Program Sub Main() ' Create a new empty workbook in a new workbook set using the current culture. Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1") ' Get a reference to the top left cell of Sheet1. Console.WriteLine(("The diameter of the earth is " + a1.Value.ToString() + " miles.")) End Sub End Module

member.returns: A new instance of in a new instance of .

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook(System.String)
member.summary: Opens an existing workbook in a newly created instance of in a new instance of .

remarks.para: This method is thread safe.
The workbook set containing the new workbook will use the US English CultureInfo. To open a workbook in a workbook set with a specific culture, use .

member.returns: A new instance of in a new instance of .

example.code: Module Program Sub Main() ' Open MyData.xls. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook("C:\\MyData.xls") ' Get a reference to the first worksheet. Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1") ' Get a reference to the top left cell of Sheet1. Dim a1 As SpreadsheetGear.IRange = worksheet.Cells("A1") ' Output the value of A1. Console.WriteLine(("[MyData.xls]Sheet1!A1 contains " + a1.Value.ToString() + ".")) End Sub End Module

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Factory.SetSignedLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the specified SpreadsheetGear signed License (see https://www.spreadsheetgear.com/downloads/signedlicense.aspx to acquire a signed license).
member.param: The specified signed license

remarks.para: This method is thread safe.
SpreadsheetGear will be limited to 1,000 rows x 100 columns x 10 worksheets x 3 workbooks if this is not the first method called in the Factory class.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat
member.summary: Specifies the file format with which to save a file.

example.code: Module Program Sub Main() ' Create a new empty workbook in a new workbook set. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook() ' Set Sheet1!A1 to "Hello World!". workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1").Cells("A1").Value = "Hello World!" ' Save to C:\MyData.xls as Excel file. workbook.SaveAs("C:\\MyData.xls", SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.Excel8) ' Open C:\MyData.xls. workbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook("C:\\MyData.xls") ' Output Sheet1!A1. System.Console.WriteLine(workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1").Cells("A1").Value.ToString()) End Sub End Module

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.Excel8
member.summary: Specifies the Biff 8 File format which is the default file format of Excel 97, Excel 2000, Excel 2002 (XP) and Excel 2003. This format is also supported by Excel 2007-2019 and Excel for Office 365. Typically saved with the .xls filename extension.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.OpenXMLWorkbook
member.summary: Specifies the Open XML file format for Excel 2007-2019 and Excel for Office 365. Typically saved with the .xlsx filename extension.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.XLS97
member.summary: Deprecated in favor of FileFormat.Excel8 to make the SpreadsheetGear API more like Excel's API. Use FileFormat.Excel8 for Excel 97 through Excel 2003 workbooks.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.CSV
member.summary: Specifies a text file of comma-separated values. Typically saved with the .csv filename extension.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.UnicodeText
member.summary: Specifies a tab-delimited Unicode text file encoded as UTF-8. Typically saved with the .txt filename extension.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.OpenXMLWorkbookMacroEnabled
member.summary: Specifies the macro enabled Open XML file format for Excel 2007-2019 and Excel for Office 365. Typically saved with the .xlsm filename extension.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.FindLookIn

member.summary: Specifies that formulas should be searched.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator
member.summary: Specifies the operator to be used by a conditional format.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.None
member.summary: No operator.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.Between
member.summary: Specifies that the cell must be between two specified values (inclusive).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.Equal
member.summary: Specifies that the cell must be equal to the specified value.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.Greater
member.summary: Specifies that the cell must be greater than the specified value.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.GreaterEqual
member.summary: Specifies that the cell must be greater than or equal to the specified value.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.Less
member.summary: Specifies that the cell must be less than the specified value.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.LessEqual
member.summary: Specifies that the cell must be less than or equal to the specified value.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.NotBetween
member.summary: Specifies that the cell must not be between the two specified values.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionOperator.NotEqual
member.summary: Specifies that the cell must not be equal to the specified value.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType
member.summary: Specifies the type of conditional format.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.None
member.summary: Specifies no format condition type

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.AboveAverageCondition
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format applies to cells which are above or below average values.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.BlanksCondition
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format applies to blank cells.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.CellValue
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format compares the value of the cell.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.ColorScale
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format is applied using color scales.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.Databar
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format is applied using data bars.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.ErrorsCondition
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format applies to cells with an error.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.Expression
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format contains a formula.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.IconSets
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format is applied using a set of icons.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.NoBlanksCondition
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format applies to cells which are not blank.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.NoErrorsCondition
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format applies to cells which do not have an error.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.TextString
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format searches for the presence or absence of a specified string.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.TimePeriod
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format applies to cells within a specified time period.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.Top10
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format applies to cells which rank in the top or bottom of values.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.FormatConditionType.UniqueValues
member.summary: Specifies that the conditional format applies to cells which have duplicate or unique values.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal alignment of a cell or object.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.General
member.summary: Specifies that text is left justified, numbers (including dates and times) are right justified, and logical values are centered.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Left
member.summary: Spedifies left justification.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Center
member.summary: Spedifies that the text should be centered.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Right
member.summary: Spedifies right justification.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Fill
member.summary: Specifies that the text will be repeated to fill the cell.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Justify
member.summary: Specifies that text should wrap and be aligned to form straight edges on the left and right, except for the last line which is left justified.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.CenterAcrossSelection
member.summary: Text is centered across empty cells in the selection without merging the cells.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Distributed
member.summary: Specifies that text should wrap and be aligned to form straight edges on the left and right, including the last line.

member.summary: Gets or sets the last author to save this workbook or null if the property named "Last author" is undefined. If any built-in document property is defined when the associated workbook is saved, will be set to if UserName is non-null, otherwise it will copy the current value from .

member.summary: Gets or sets the built-in revision number property which is named "Revision number". If null is returned the property is undefined. Setting this property to null has the same effect as calling on the associated document property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the last print date and time or null if the "Last print time" property is undefined. All retunred times will be DateTimeKind.Utc, and non-Utc DateTime's will be converted to DateTimeKind.Utc at the time they are set. Setting this property to null has the same effect as calling on the associated document property.

Setting this property to null has the same effect as calling on the associated document property.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IChartSheetWindowInfos.Count

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.IColors
member.summary: Represents the color palette of a workbook.

remarks.para: Text and object colors are stored internally as indexes into a palette. Every workbook is created with a default color palette. Use the IColors interface to query the color palette or to modify it.

Most objects provide the option of specifying a color as an index into this color palette or as an instance of SpreadsheetGear.Color, in which case the actual color to be used will be the color in the palette which is closest to the specified SpreadsheetGear.Color.
Workbooks with a custom color palette are saved with the custom palette.

members.member:
Gets or sets the color at the specified zero based index.
The zero based index of the color to get or set. #

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IColors.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of colors in the color palette.

member.summary: Returns the document property specified by the zero based index.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IDocumentProperties.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new custom document property with the specified value (System.String, System.DateTime, System.Boolean, System.Int32 or System.Double) to a workbook and returns a reference to it.
member.param: The name of the new document property.

The value of the new document property which must be an instance of System.String with a length of 255 characters or less, System.DateTime on or after January 1st, 1901, System.Boolean, System.Int32, or a valid System.Double.
member.returns: The added document property.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IDocumentProperties.Clear
member.summary: Removes all document properties from this collection.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.IDocumentProperty
member.summary: Represents a built-in or custom document property associated with a workbook.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IDocumentProperty.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this document property (built-in property names cannot not be changed).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IDocumentProperty.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of this document property which must be an instance of System.String with a length of 255 characters or less, System.DateTime on or after January 1st, 1901, System.Boolean, System.Int32, or a valid System.Double. Custom properties never return null and may not be set to null. Builtin properties may return null if they are undefined and may be set to null. All retunred DateTime's will be DateTimeKind.Utc, and non-Utc DateTime's will be converted to DateTimeKind.Utc at the time they are set.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IDocumentProperty.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent custom or built-in properties collection of this property.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IDocumentProperty.Delete
member.summary: Deletes this document property from the workbook.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.IName
member.summary: Represents a defined name.

example.code: Class Program Shared Sub Main() ' Create a workbook. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook("2005 Sales.xls") ' Enumerate the defined names. Dim name As SpreadsheetGear.IName For Each name In workbook.Names System.Console.WriteLine("Name={0} Formula={1} FormulaR1C1={2}", name.Name, name.RefersTo, name.RefersToR1C1) Next name End Sub 'Main End Class 'Program

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IName.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets the comment associated with this defined name.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IName.Index
member.summary: Returns the zero based index of the defined name in the INames collection of the workbook to which it belongs.
member.remarks: Note that this index is into the workbook defined name collection, not a worksheet defined names collection.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IName.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the defined name.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IName.RefersTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the formula which the defined name refers to.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IName.RefersToR1C1
member.summary: Gets or sets the formula which the defined name refers to in R1C1 notation.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IName.RefersToRange
member.summary: Returns the IRange which this defined name refers to.
member.remarks: If the defined name does not refer to a range, null is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IName.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which determines whether this defined name is visible to the user.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IName.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the defined name.
member.remarks: The defined name will remain in the workbook with no formula if other formulas refer to it.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.INames
member.summary: Represents the collection of defined names in a workbook or worksheet.

example.code: Class Program Shared Sub Main() ' Create a workbook. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook() ' Get the worksheet and change the name. Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1") worksheet.Name = "2005 Sales" ' Get the worksheet cells reference. Dim cells As SpreadsheetGear.IRange = worksheet.Cells ' Add column headers. cells("B1").Formula = "Jan" cells("C1").Formula = "Feb" cells("D1").Formula = "Mar" ' Add row headers. cells("A2").Formula = "Jennifer" cells("A3").Formula = "William" cells("A4").Formula = "Kristen" ' Add random data. cells("B2:D4").Formula = "=RAND()*10000" ' Center the column headers. cells("B1:D1").HorizontalAlignment = SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Center ' Bold the row and column headers. cells("B1:D1,A2:A4").Font.Bold = True ' Add defined names. Dim names As SpreadsheetGear.INames = workbook.Names names.Add("Jan", "='2005 Sales'!$B$2:$B$4") names.Add("Feb", "='2005 Sales'!$C$2:$C$4") names.Add("Mar", "='2005 Sales'!$D$2:$D$4") names.Add("Sales", "='2005 Sales'!$B$2:$D$4") ' Format sales data as currency. cells("Sales").NumberFormat = "$#,##0" ' Sum each month. cells("B5").Formula = "=SUM(Jan)" cells("C5").Formula = "=SUM(Feb)" cells("D5").Formula = "=SUM(Mar)" ' Format sums. cells("B5:D5").NumberFormat = "$#,##0" ' Write the workbook. workbook.SaveAs("2005 Sales.xls", SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.Excel8) End Sub 'Main End Class 'Program

member.summary: Gets or sets the starting page number.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.FitToPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether printing should scale printed output to the number of pages specified by FitToPagesTall and FitToPagesWide.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.FitToPagesTall
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of vertical pages to fit printed output to.

remarks.para: Set FitToPagesTall to zero to fit horizontally but not vertically.
Setting FitToPagesTall to a non-zero value sets to true.
Setting FitToPagesTall and FitToPagesWide to zero sets FitToPages to false.
FitToPagesTall has no effect when FitToPages is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.FitToPagesWide
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of horizontal pages to fit printed output to.

remarks.para: Set FitToPagesWide to zero to fit vertically but not horizontally.
Setting FitToPagesTall to a non-zero value sets to true.
Setting FitToPagesTall and FitToPagesWide to zero sets FitToPages to false.
FitToPagesTall has no effect when FitToPages is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PaperSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies the size of the paper to print to.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the area of the worksheet to print using ReferenceStyle.A1.

remarks.para: A string with a length of zero is returned if there is no print area.
When no print area is defined, the used range of the worksheet is printed.
The print area of a worksheet is stored in the sheet specific defined name "Print_Area".

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintComments
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether and where to print cell comments.
member.remarks: This setting is read, written and maintained but is not taken into account when SpreadsheetGear prints a workbook.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether and how to print cell errors.
member.remarks: This setting is read, written and maintained but is not taken into account when SpreadsheetGear prints a workbook.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintGridlines
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether gridlines are printed.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintHeadings
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether row and column headings are printed.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether to print cell comments after the worksheet.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true is equivalent to setting PrintComments to PrintLocation.SheetEnd.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the print quality in dots per inch.

remarks.para: Set to zero to use the default resolution of the output device.
To print at non-square resolutions, set to the horizontal resolution and set to the vertical resolution.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintQualityVertical
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical print quality in dots per inch.

remarks.para: When printing with square resolutions, such as at 600x600 DPI, set to zero.
To print at non-square resolutions, set to the horizontal resolution and to the vertical resolution.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintTitleColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the columns to repeat on each printed page using ReferenceStyle.A1.

remarks.para: A string with a length of zero is returned if there are no print title columns.
The print title columns are stored in the sheet specific defined name "Print_Titles".

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.PrintTitleRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the rows to repeat on each printed page using ReferenceStyle.A1.

remarks.para: A string with a length of zero is returned if there are no print title rows.
The print title rows are stored in the sheet specific defined name "Print_Titles".

member.summary: Gets or sets the top margin for printing in points.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPageSetup.Zoom

Setting Zoom sets to false.
Zoom has no effect when FitToPages is true.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.IPane
member.summary: Represents a worksheet window pane.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IPane.Index
member.summary: Returns the index of this pane.

remarks.para: If the window has four panes, the values returned by index are:
Upper left = 0
Upper right = 1
Lower left = 2
Lower right = 3
If the window has two panes, the top or left pane is 0 and the bottom or right pane is 1.
If the window has one pane, Index returns 0.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowDeletingColumns
member.summary: Determines if deleting columns is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowDeletingRows
member.summary: Determines if deleting rows is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Determines if changing the criteria of an existing autofilter is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowFormattingCells
member.summary: Determines if formatting cells is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowFormattingColumns
member.summary: Determines if formatting columns is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowFormattingRows
member.summary: Determines if formatting rows is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowInsertingColumns
member.summary: Determines if inserting columns is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowInsertingHyperlinks
member.summary: Determines if inserting hyperlinks is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowInsertingRows
member.summary: Determines if inserting rows is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowSorting
member.summary: Determines if sorting unlocked cells is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IProtection.AllowUsingPivotTables
member.summary: Determines if using pivot tables is allowed while the worksheet is protected.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.IRange
member.summary: Represents one or more cells, rows, columns, or ranges of cells.

example.code: Class Program Shared Sub Main() ' Create a workbook. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook() ' Get the worksheet and change the name. Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1") worksheet.Name = "2005 Sales" ' Get the worksheet cells reference. Dim cells As SpreadsheetGear.IRange = worksheet.Cells ' Add column headers using a string index into the cells range. cells("B1").Formula = "Jan" cells("C1").Formula = "Feb" cells("D1").Formula = "Mar" ' Add row headers using zero based row and column indexes. cells(1, 0).Formula = "Jennifer" cells(2, 0).Formula = "William" cells(3, 0).Formula = "Kristen" ' Add random data using a multiple cell string index. cells("B2:D4").Formula = "=RAND()*10000" ' Center the column headers using multiple cell row and column indexes. cells(0, 1, 0, 3).HorizontalAlignment = SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Center ' Bold the row and column headers using a string index to multiple ranges. cells("B1:D1,A2:A4").Font.Bold = True ' Format the data as currency. cells("B2:D4").NumberFormat = "$#,##0" ' Write the workbook. workbook.SaveAs("2005 Sales.xls", SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.Excel8) End Sub 'Main End Class 'Program

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a new instance of IRange which is offset from this IRange.

example.code: Class Program Shared Sub Main() ' Create a workbook. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook() ' Get the worksheet and change the name. Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1") worksheet.Name = "2005 Sales" ' Get the worksheet cells reference. Dim cells As SpreadsheetGear.IRange = worksheet.Cells ' Add column headers using a string index into the cells range. cells("B1").Formula = "Jan" cells("C1").Formula = "Feb" cells("D1").Formula = "Mar" ' Add row headers using zero based row and column indexes. cells(1, 0).Formula = "Jennifer" cells(2, 0).Formula = "William" cells(3, 0).Formula = "Kristen" ' Add random data using a multiple cell string index. cells("B2:D4").Formula = "=RAND()*10000" ' Center the column headers using multiple cell row and column indexes. cells(0, 1, 0, 3).HorizontalAlignment = SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Center ' Bold the row and column headers using a string index to multiple ranges. cells("B1:D1,A2:A4").Font.Bold = True ' Format the data as currency. cells("B2:D4").NumberFormat = "$#,##0" ' Write the workbook. workbook.SaveAs("2005 Sales.xls", SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.Excel8) End Sub 'Main End Class 'Program

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new single cell instance of IRange which is offset from the top-left cell of the current IRange.
member.param: The offset for the row of the new range (may be negative).
The offset for the column of the new range (may be negative).

example.code: Class Program Shared Sub Main() ' Create a workbook. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook() ' Get the worksheet and change the name. Dim cells As SpreadsheetGear.IRange = worksheet.Cells ' Add column headers using a string index into the cells range. cells("B1").Formula = "Jan" cells("C1").Formula = "Feb" cells("D1").Formula = "Mar" ' Add row headers using zero based row and column indexes. cells(1, 0).Formula = "Jennifer" cells(2, 0).Formula = "William" cells(3, 0).Formula = "Kristen" ' Add random data using a multiple cell string index. cells("B2:D4").Formula = "=RAND()*10000" ' Center the column headers using multiple cell row and column indexes. cells(0, 1, 0, 3).HorizontalAlignment = SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Center ' Bold the row and column headers using a string index to multiple ranges. cells("B1:D1,A2:A4").Font.Bold = True ' Format the data as currency. cells("B2:D4").NumberFormat = "$#,##0" ' Write the workbook. workbook.SaveAs("2005 Sales.xls", SpreadsheetGear.FileFormat.Excel8) End Sub 'Main End Class 'Program

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.param: The offset for the top row of the new range (may be negative).

The offset for the bottom row of the new range (may be negative).
The offset for the right column of the new range (may be negative).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.AddIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which controls indentation of text when horizontal or vertical alignment is set to distributed.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.AddIndentDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the AddIndent property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Address
member.summary: Returns the cell or range address of the cells represented by this IRange using ReferenceStyle.A1.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.AllowEdit
member.summary: Returns true if all of the cells represented by a range may be edited.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.AreaCount
member.summary: Returns the number of areas in this IRange.
member.remarks: IRange.AreaCount and IRange.GetArea(int index) provide the same functionality as IRange.Areas.Count and IRange.Areas[int index] without the overhead of creating an instance of IAreas.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Areas
member.summary: Returns an instance of IAreas which represents an array of IRanges where each IRange returned by IAreas represents one cell or range.

remarks.para: If this IRange contains only a single cell or range, the same single cell or range will be represented by the returned IRange of IArea.
IRange.AreaCount and IRange.GetArea(int index) provide the same functionality as IRange.Areas.Count and IRange.Areas[int index] without the overhead of creating an instance of IAreas.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Borders
member.summary: Returns an instance of IBorders which represents the cell borders of the cell or range represented by this IRange.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Cells
member.summary: Returns the cells represented by this instance of IRange.

example.code:
Class Program Shared Sub Main() ' Create a worksheet. Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook().Worksheets("Sheet1")
' Writes "6" (two columns by three rows). System.Console.WriteLine(worksheet.Cells("B3:C5").Count)
' Writes "2" (two columns). System.Console.WriteLine(worksheet.Cells("B3:C5").Columns.Count)
' Writes "6" (back to two columns by three rows). System.Console.WriteLine(worksheet.Cells("B3:C5").Columns.Cells.Count) End Sub 'Main End Class 'Program

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Column
member.summary: Returns the zero based column number of the first column of this IRange.
member.remarks: If this IRange contains multiple areas, the first column number of the first area is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.ColumnCount
member.summary: Returns the number of columns in this IRange.
member.remarks: If this IRange contains multiple areas, the number of columns in the first area is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Columns
member.summary: Returns a new instance of IRange which represents the same range of cells but which may be used to determine the number of columns in the range or to AutoFit the columns in the range.
member.remarks: If the IRange represents more than one range of cells, only the first range of cells is represented in the new IRange.

example.code: int numberOfCols = worksheet.Cells["A1:B3"].Columns.Count; // 2 columns
Dim numberOfCols As Integer = worksheet.Cells("A1:B3").Columns.Count ' 2 columns

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.ColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the individual columns represented this range in characters.

example.code: range.ColumnWidth = 10.5; // Set column width to 10.5 characters.
range.ColumnWidth = 10.5 ' Set column width to 10.5 characters.

member.remarks: The default font is used to determine the width of a character.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.ColumnWidthDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the ColumnWidth property of all columns represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Comment
member.summary: Returns an instance of IComment representing the comment which is associated the single cell represented by this range, or null if there is no comment.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Count
member.summary: Deprecated - use CellCount, RowCount or ColumnCount.

example.code: int numberOfCells = worksheet.Cells["A1:B3"].Count; // 6 cells int numberOfRows = worksheet.Cells["A1:B3"].Rows.Count; // 3 rows int numberOfCols = worksheet.Cells["A1:B3"].Columns.Count; // 2 columns

Dim numberOfCells As Integer = worksheet.Cells("A1:B3").Count ' 6 cells Dim numberOfRows As Integer = worksheet.Cells("A1:B3").Rows.Count ' 3 rows Dim numberOfCols As Integer = worksheet.Cells("A1:B3").Columns.Count ' 2 columns

member.remarks: NOTE: This property will throw an exception if the count exceeds Int32.MaxValue.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.CellCount
member.summary: Returns the number of cells represented by this range.

example.code: long numberOfCells = worksheet.Cells["A1:XFD1048576"].CellCount; // 17,179,869,184 cells
Dim numberOfCells As Long = worksheet.Cells("A1:XFD1048576").CellCount ' 17179869184 cells

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.CurrentArray
member.summary: Returns the range of cells containing the array formula of the top-left cell of this IRange, or null if the top-left cell is not an array formula.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.CurrentRegion
member.summary: Returns an expanded range of contiguous non-empty cells.
member.remarks: The range is continually expanded until there are no non-empty cells above, below, or beside it.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.EndDown
member.summary: Returns a single cell at the end of the current contiguous non-empty range, or at the start of the next non-empty range, starting with the top-left cell of this range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.EndLeft
member.summary: Returns a single cell at the start of the current contiguous non-empty range, or at the end of the previous non-empty range, starting with the top-left cell of this range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.EndRight
member.summary: Returns a single cell at the end of the current contiguous non-empty range, or at the start of the next non-empty range, starting with the top-left cell of this range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.EndUp
member.summary: Returns a single cell at the start of the current contiguous non-empty range, or at the end of the previous non-empty range, starting with the top-left cell of this range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.EntireColumn
member.summary: Returns a new instance of IRange which represents the same range of cells, but expanded to include all rows.

example.code: IRange cols = worksheet.Cells["A1:B3"].EntireColumn; // 'cols' represents A:B
Dim cols As IRange = worksheet.Cells("A1:B3").EntireColumn ' 'cols' represents A:B

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.EntireMergeArea
member.summary: Returns an IRange representing the area of the current IRange which is iteratively grown as needed until it includes no partial merged cells.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.EntireRow
member.summary: Returns a new instance of IRange which represents the same range of cells, but expanded to include all columns.

example.code: IRange rows = worksheet.Cells["A1:B3"].EntireRow; // 'rows' represents A1:IV3
Dim rows As IRange = worksheet.Cells("A1:B3").EntireRow ' 'rows' represents A1:IV3

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Entry
member.summary: Returns the text which is displayed in the workbook view's formula bar.

remarks.para: The workbook view displays text in the formula bar in a form which is easier to work with than the raw value of a cell.
For example, Entry will return "5%" for a cell with the number 0.05 formatted as "0%" and will return "1/1/2006" for a cell with the number 38718 formatted as "mm/dd/yyyy".
Array formulas will not include the curly braces which are displayed in the formula bar.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Font
member.summary: Returns an instance of IFont which may be used to get and set font properties of the cells represented by this IRange.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.FormatConditions
member.summary: Returns a collection which represents the conditional formatting options of this range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.FormatConditionsDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the conditional formatting options of all cells represented by this IRange are the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Formula
member.summary: Gets the formula, or sets the value or formula, of the cells represented by this IRange.

remarks.para: To put a formula in a cell, the first character must be '='. Otherwise, attempts will be made to convert the specified string to a number, date, time, date/time, logical or error value. If none of these succeed, the value will be set in the cell as text.
To put text in a cell without attempting to parse the string, use a leading single quote. Setting a cell to "'66044" will place the text "66044" into the cell without any parsing.

When a value is converted from a string to a number, an appropriate number format is applied to the cell. For example, setting Formula to "10%" sets the value of the cell to 0.1 and sets the number format of the cell to "0%". The number format of the cell will not be changed unless it is a different type, such as putting "5%" into a cell currently formatted as currency.
The System.Globalization.CultureInfo of the current workbook set is used to determine how to parse dates, times, numbers and currency values.
Use to get the value of the cell represented by this or use to get the formatted value of the cell.

example.code:
' Set cells to a formula which referes to the top-left cell in the worksheet. range.Formula = "=$A$1"
' Set cells to a formula for Pi. range.Formula = "=PI()"
' Set cells to the text "Hello World!". range.Formula = "Hello World!"
' Set cells to the number 123.5. range.Formula = "123.5"
' Set cells to the text "66044" without parsing by using a leading single quote. range.Formula = "'66044"
' Set cells to the number represented by the date "4/20/2005" and format the cell as a date. range.Formula = "4/20/2005"
' Set cells to the logical value TRUE. range.Formula = "True"
' Set cells to the error value #N/A. range.Formula = "#n/a"

member.value: Returns the formula of the cell represented by this .

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.FormulaArray
member.summary: Gets or sets the array formula for a range.
member.remarks: An array formula may be placed in a single cell or multiple cells.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.FormulaHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether formulas should be hidden.
member.remarks: Hiding formulas will have no affect unless is set to true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.FormulaHiddenDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the FormulaHidden property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.FormulaR1C1
member.summary: Gets or sets the value or formula of the cells represented by this IRange using ReferenceStyle.R1C1.
member.remarks: To put a formula in a cell, the first character must be '='. Otherwise, attempts will be made to convert the specified string to a number, date, time, date/time, logical or error value. If none of these succeed, the value will be set in the cell as text.

example.code: // Set cells to a formula which referes to the top-left cell in the worksheet. range.FormulaR1C1 = "=R1C1";
' Set cells to a formula which referes to the top-left cell in the worksheet. range.FormulaR1C1 = "=R1C1"

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.HasArray
member.summary: Returns true if the cell or range contains any array formulas, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.HasArrayDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the HasArray property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.HasFormula
member.summary: Returns true if the cell or range contains any formulas, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.HasFormulaDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the HasFormula property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.HasValidation
member.summary: Returns true if any of the cells represented by this range have data validation associated with them.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Height
member.summary: Returns the height of the range in points.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Hidden
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether rows or columns should be hidden.
member.remarks: This property only works on ranges returned by IRange.Rows, IRange.EntireRows, IRange.Columns and IRange.EntireColumns.

code.description: Hide column B of a worksheet.

example.code:
' Create a worksheet. Dim worksheet As IWorksheet = Factory.GetWorkbook().Worksheets(0)
' Hide column B of the worksheet. worksheet.Cells("B:B").Columns.Hidden = True

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of a cell or range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.HorizontalAlignmentDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the HorizontalAlignment property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Hyperlinks
member.summary: Returns a hyperlink collection representing the hyperlinks which are attached to this range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.IsDisposed
member.summary: Returns true if the worksheet referred to by this range has been disposed.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.IsEntireColumns
member.summary: Returns true if the current range represents one or more entire columns.
member.remarks: If the current IRange represents more than one range of cells, IsEntireColumns will only return true if every range of cells represents one or more entire columns.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.IsEntireRows
member.summary: Returns true if the current range represents one or more entire rows.
member.remarks: If the current IRange represents more than one range of cells, IsEntireRows will only return true if every range of cells represents one or more entire rows.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.IsVolatileOrCircularFormula
member.summary: Returns true if the single cell range is, or depends on, a volatile function or circular reference.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.IndentLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent level of the specified cell(s).
member.remarks: The IndentLevel propert indents from the left for HAlign.Left, from the right for HAlign.Right or from the left and right for HAlign.Distributed. If IndentLevel is set to a non-zero value and the property is not currently set to one of these three values, will be set to HAlign.Left.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Interior
member.summary: Returns the IInterior which represents the interior (background) color and pattern of the specified cell(s).
member.remarks: The interior color and pattern of a cell is used to paint the background.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether cells should be locked.
member.remarks: Locking cells will have no affect unless is set to true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.LockedDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the Locked property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.MergeArea
member.summary: Returns an IRange representing the merged cell area if the cell represented by this single cell IRange is part of a merged cell range, otherwise the original IRange is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.MergeCells
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies whether the top left cell of this IRange is merged.
member.remarks: Setting MergeCells to true has the same effect as calling IRange.Merge(). Setting MergeCells to false has the same effect as calling IRange.UnMerge().

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.MergeCellsDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the MergeCells property of all cells represented by this IRange is false or if all cells represented by this IRange are contained by the same merged cell area, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Name
member.summary: Returns the first defined name which refers to the cells represented by this range, or null if no defined name refers to the range.

remarks.para: The IRange.Worksheet.Workbook.Names collection is searched in ascending order.
If no matching defined name is found, null is returned.
Only simple defined names are searched. For example, a defined name which uses the OFFSET() worksheet function will not be considered.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.NumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the number format of the cells in the range.
member.remarks: SpreadsheetGear number formats are compatible with Microsoft Excel number formats.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.NumberFormatType
member.summary: Returns the number format type of the top-left cell of this range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.NumberFormatDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the NumberFormat property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.OutlineLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the outline level of a range of rows or columns, which provides the ability to group and summarize information.

example.code:
' Create a new workbook. Dim workbook As SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook = SpreadsheetGear.Factory.GetWorkbook() Dim worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets("Sheet1") Dim cells As SpreadsheetGear.IRange = worksheet.Cells
' Set the worksheet name. worksheet.Name = "2004 Sales"
' Load column titles and center. cells("B1").Formula = "Mary" cells("C1").Formula = "Tom" cells("D1").Formula = "Jane" cells("E1").Formula = "Rick" cells("B1:E1").HorizontalAlignment = SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Center
' Load row titles and align right. Dim quarter As Integer For quarter = 1 To 4 cells(quarter, 0).Formula = "Q" + Convert.ToString(quarter) Next quarter cells("A6").Formula = "Total" cells("A1:A6").HorizontalAlignment = SpreadsheetGear.HAlign.Right
' Load random data Dim rand As New Random() Dim row As Integer For row = 1 To 4 Dim col As Integer For col = 1 To 4 cells(row, col).Value = rand.Next(1000, 10000) Next col Next row
' Sum each column. cells("B6").Formula = "=SUM(B2:B5)" cells("C6").Formula = "=SUM(C2:C5)" cells("D6").Formula = "=SUM(D2:D5)" cells("E6").Formula = "=SUM(E2:E5)"
' Format values as currency. cells("B2:E6").NumberFormat = "$#,##0_)"
' Set the outline level cells("2:5").Rows.OutlineLevel = 2

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.OutlineLevelDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the OutlineLevel property of all rows or columns represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the text orientation of a cell or range, which may be from -90 to 90 degrees or SpreadsheetGear.Orientation.Vertical.
member.remarks: See the SpreadsheetGear.Orientation class for related constants.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.OrientationDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the Orientation property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.PageBreak
member.summary: Adds or removes manual page breaks for a range.

remarks.para: Set this property to PageBreak.Manual to add a manual page break, or PageBreak.None to remove a manual page break.
If the range represents entire rows, a page break is added or removed before the first row of the range.
If the range represents entire columns, a page break is added or removed before the first column of the range.
If the range represents neither entire rows nor entire columns, a page break is added or removed before the first row and first column of the range.
To remove all manual page breaks from a worksheet, set IWorksheet.Cells.PageBreak to PageBreak.None.

example.code: Sub SetPageBreak(worksheet As SpreadsheetGear.IWorksheet, row As Integer, col As Integer) worksheet.Cells(row, col).PageBreak = SpreadsheetGear.PageBreak.Manual End Sub 'SetPageBreak

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.PrefixCharacter
member.summary: Returns '\'' if text was entered into a cell with a leading apostrophe, otherwise '\0' is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.PrefixCharacterDefined
member.summary: Returns true if the PrefixCharacter property of all cells represented by this IRange is the same, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Rows
member.summary: Returns a new instance of IRange which represents the same range of cells but which may be used to determine the number of rows in the range or to AutoFit the rows in the range.
member.remarks: If the IRange represents more than one range of cells, only the first range of cells is represented in the new IRange.

example.code: int numberOfRows = worksheet.Cells["A1:B3"].Rows.Count; // 3 rows
Dim numberOfRows As Integer = worksheet.Cells("A1:B3").Rows.Count ' 3 rows

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Text
member.summary: Returns the value of the cell represented by this IRange as a formatted string.

remarks.para: The value of the cell is formatted using the number format of the cell and returned as a string.

Note: Microsoft Excel truncates the number of significant digits displayed, or displays "######" for numbers which do not fit, based on the column width and font of the cell. SpreadsheetGear does not limit the returned text in this way.
Use the property to get the raw data of the cell (such as a Double for dates and times).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Validation

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.ValidationDefined

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified range as a System.String, System.Double, System.Boolean, SpreadsheetGear.ValueError, object[,] or null; or sets the value of the specified cell as a System.String, System.Double, System.Int32, System.Int64, System.Int16, System.Char, System.Boolean, System.DateTime, SpreadsheetGear.ValueError, System.Decimal, System.DBNull, object[,] or null.

remarks.para: An empty cell returns a value of null.
Setting Value to null or to an empty string clears the value from the cell.

Setting Value to a string has the same affect as setting to the same string, the only difference being that setting directly is faster. See for more information on the parsing of string values to numbers, dates, times, errors, logical values and text.

Dates and times are stored internally as a System.Double. Setting Value to a System.DateTime converts the date and/or time to a System.Double. Use and to convert from a System.DateTime to a number suitable for a cell and back.
The Value property returns the raw data of a cell. Use to get the formula of a cell or use to get the formatted value of a cell.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.AutoFit
member.summary: Automatically sets the width of the specified columns or the height of the specified rows.
member.remarks: When IRange.AutoFit is used on columns, the width of the columns is set to the appropriate width immediately. However, for rows, the height is set to the default height and a flag is set indicating that the row height is automatic, and Excel will actually set the height when the row is displayed.

example.code:
' Automatically set the width on columns B and C. worksheet.Cells("B:C").Columns.AutoFit()
' Set the row height to automatic on rows 7 through 9. worksheet.Cells("7:9").Rows.AutoFit()

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Copy(SpreadsheetGear.IRange)
member.summary: Copies the cells, rows and/or columns of the current IRange to the destination IRange.
member.remarks: If the current range is not large enough to fill the destination range, the current range is repeated.

example.code:
Imports System Imports SpreadsheetGear
Namespace SpreadsheetGear.CopySample Class Program Public Overloads Shared Sub Main() ' Create a workbook Dim workbook As IWorkbook = Factory.GetWorkbook() Dim worksheet As IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets(0) Dim cells As IRange = worksheet.Cells
' Put some data in the workbook. cells("A2").Value = "Corn" cells("A3").Value = "Wheat" cells("A4").Value = "Barley" cells("B1").Value = "Jan" cells("C1").Value = "Feb" cells("D1").Value = "Mar" cells("B2:D4").Formula = "=RAND()*10000"
' Make a copy in the same workbook - the destination will be ' automatically sized to fit the source. cells("A1:D4").Copy(cells("A6"))
' Create a 2nd worksheet. Dim worksheet2 As IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets.Add()
' Copy from the first worksheet to the 2nd. cells("A1:D4").Copy(worksheet2.Cells("A1"))
' Save to disk. workbook.SaveAs("c:\CopySample.xls", FileFormat.Excel8) End Sub 'Main ' End Class 'Program End Namespace 'SpreadsheetGear.CopySample

member.param: The destination range.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Copy(SpreadsheetGear.IRange,SpreadsheetGear.PasteType,SpreadsheetGear.PasteOperation,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies the cells, rows and/or columns of the current IRange to the destination IRange using the specified options.
member.param: The destination range.
Specifies what to paste.
Specifies how to combine values.
Specifies whether blanks in the source range should be skipped (formatted cells with no data are considered blank cells).
Specifies whether data should be transposed in the destination.

remarks.para: Column widths, column formats and column outlines are copied if entire columns are being copied.
Row heights, row formats and row outlines are copied if entire rows are being copied.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.CopyDown
member.summary: Copies values, formulas and formats in the top row of the range to subsequent rows.
member.remarks: NOTE: This method is obsolete. Use the method.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.CopyFromDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags)
member.summary: Copies the specified DataTable to this range.
member.param: Specifies the source DataTable.
Specifies options including All Text values, No Column Headers and Insert Cells.

remarks.para: If this range is a single column, the destination range will be expanded to the number of columns in the DataTable.
If this range is a single row, the destination will be expanded to the number of rows in the DataTable, plus one row for the column headers if needed.

Note that you must specify a single data row and allow the destination size to be determined automatically if you use to enable wrapping rows to the next worksheet if they do not fit on the current worksheet.

Using Formats and Formulas
To preformat a range and have formulas refer to columns in the range, specify the SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.InsertCells flag. When specifying this flag, you must provide a range with exactly two rows for data, preceded by a row for column headers if SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.NoColumnHeaders is not specified.

Specifying this flag instructs SpreadsheetGear to insert or delete rows as needed to accommodate the number of rows in the source DataTable, and to copy down values or formulas in extra columns which enables "calculated columns". This allows the cells to be preformatted and allows formulas to reference cells within the destination range. If the DataTable contains no rows, both data rows will be deleted and any formula references to these cells will be changed to #REF!. Otherwise, formulas referring to cells in the second initial row will be fixed up to refer to the last row of data inserted into the worksheet.

DataTable Column Names to Range Column Headers
By default, column names are copied to the first row in the specified range. To disable this functionality, specify SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.NoColumnHeaders.

Forcing Some or All Values to Text
Normally, an attempt is made to parse values as they are placed into cells. To force all values to be entered into cells as text, specify the SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.AllText flag. To force only specific columns to be placed into cells as text, use the SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.InsertCells flag which enables you to preformat these columns as text cells (IRange.NumberFormat = "@").

member.example: See DataSet to Excel Workbook with Formats and Formulas in the Excel Reporting Samples and DataTable to Excel Workbook with Formats and Formulas in the Excel to DataGrid Samples for examples of using CopyFromDataTable.

member.summary: Attempts to achieve the specified goal, from the calculated result of the formula in the cell represented by this IRange, by modifying the specified changingCell using a simple iterative linear search.
member.returns: true if the desired goal is achieved or false if the goal is not achieved.

remarks.para: This GoalSeek method uses a simple iterative linear search for a value which, when placed in the cell specified by changingCell, yields a calculated result very close to the specified goal from the formula in the cell represented by this .
The cell represented by this IRange should contain a formula which is directly or indirectly dependant on the cell specified by changingCell.
The cell specified by changingCell will contain the value used to achieve the desired goal if this method is successful.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Insert
member.summary: Inserts rows or columns by shifting rows down or columns right and fixing up formulas and formats.
member.remarks: Must be performed on entire row(s) or entire column(s).

example.code:
Imports System Imports SpreadsheetGear Imports System.Diagnostics
Namespace SpreadsheetGear.InsertExample
Class Program
Shared Sub Main() ' Create a workbook. Dim workbook As IWorkbook = Factory.GetWorkbook() Dim worksheet As IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets(0) Dim cells As IRange = worksheet.Cells
' Set some text in A1:B2. cells("A1").Formula = "A1" cells("A2").Formula = "A2" cells("B1").Formula = "B1" cells("B2").Formula = "B2"
' Insert two rows before row 2. cells("2:3").Insert()
' Insert three columns before column 'B'. cells("B:D").Insert()
' Verify new locations - A1 has not moved. Debug.Assert(cells("A1").Formula.Equals("A1")) ' A2 has been moved down two rows. Debug.Assert(cells("A4").Formula.Equals("A2")) ' B1 has been moved right three columns. Debug.Assert(cells("E1").Formula.Equals("B1")) ' B2 has been moved down two rows and right three columns. Debug.Assert(cells("E4").Formula.Equals("B2"))
' Insert one cell before E4 shifting E4 down to E5. cells("E4").Insert(InsertShiftDirection.Down) Debug.Assert(cells("E5").Formula.Equals("B2"))
' Insert one cell before E5 shifting E5 right to F5. cells("E5").Insert(InsertShiftDirection.Right) Debug.Assert(cells("F5").Formula.Equals("B2")) End Sub 'Main End Class 'Program End Namespace 'SpreadsheetGear.InsertExample

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Insert(SpreadsheetGear.InsertShiftDirection)
member.summary: Inserts cells, rows or columns by shifting cells right or down and fixing up formulas and formats.
member.param: Specifies whether to shift cells right or down.

example.code:
Imports System Imports SpreadsheetGear Imports System.Diagnostics
Namespace SpreadsheetGear.InsertExample
Class Program
Shared Sub Main() ' Create a workbook. Dim workbook As IWorkbook = Factory.GetWorkbook() Dim worksheet As IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets(0) Dim cells As IRange = worksheet.Cells
' Set some text in A1:B2. cells("A1").Formula = "A1" cells("A2").Formula = "A2" cells("B1").Formula = "B1" cells("B2").Formula = "B2"
' Insert two rows before row 2. cells("2:3").Insert()
' Insert three columns before column 'B'. cells("B:D").Insert()
' Verify new locations - A1 has not moved. Debug.Assert(cells("A1").Formula.Equals("A1")) ' A2 has been moved down two rows. Debug.Assert(cells("A4").Formula.Equals("A2")) ' B1 has been moved right three columns. Debug.Assert(cells("E1").Formula.Equals("B1")) ' B2 has been moved down two rows and right three columns. Debug.Assert(cells("E4").Formula.Equals("B2"))
' Insert one cell before E4 shifting E4 down to E5. cells("E4").Insert(InsertShiftDirection.Down) Debug.Assert(cells("E5").Formula.Equals("B2"))
' Insert one cell before E5 shifting E5 right to F5. cells("E5").Insert(InsertShiftDirection.Right) Debug.Assert(cells("F5").Formula.Equals("B2")) End Sub 'Main End Class 'Program End Namespace 'SpreadsheetGear.InsertExample

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Intersect(SpreadsheetGear.IRange)
member.summary: Returns a new range which consists of the intersection of this range and range2, or null if the ranges do not intersect.
member.returns: A new range consisting of the intersection of this range and range2, or null if the ranges do not intersect.

example.code:
Public Sub RangeIntersectUnionSubtract() ' Create a workbook to play with. Dim workbook As IWorkbook = Factory.GetWorkbook() Dim worksheet As IWorksheet = workbook.Worksheets(0) Dim cells As IRange = worksheet.Cells
' Create some ranges. Dim a1 As IRange = cells("A1") Dim a1_b3 As IRange = cells("A1:B3") Dim b3_d4 As IRange = cells("B3:D4")
' A variable to hold results. Dim range As IRange
' A1 does not intersect with B3:D4 range = a1.Intersect(b3_d4) Debug.Assert(range Is Nothing)
' Subtracting B3:D4 from A1 does not change A1. range = a1.Subtract(b3_d4) Debug.Assert(Not (range Is Nothing) And range.Address.Equals("$A$1"))
' The union of A1 and B3:D4 is "A1,B3:D4". range = a1.Union(b3_d4) Debug.Assert(Not (range Is Nothing) And range.Address.Equals("$A$1,$B$3:$D$4"))
' B3:D4 does not intersect with A1. range = b3_d4.Intersect(a1) Debug.Assert(range Is Nothing)
' Subtracting A1 from B3:D4 does not change B3:D4. range = b3_d4.Subtract(a1) Debug.Assert(Not (range Is Nothing) And range.Address.Equals("$B$3:$D$4"))
' The union of B3:D4 and A1 is "A1,B3:D4". range = b3_d4.Union(a1) Debug.Assert(Not (range Is Nothing) And range.Address.Equals("$A$1,$B$3:$D$4"))
' The intersection of B3:D4 and A1:B3 is B3 range = b3_d4.Intersect(a1_b3) Debug.Assert(Not (range Is Nothing) And range.Address.Equals("$B$3"))
' Subtracting A1:B3 from B3:D4 leaves "C3:D3,B4:D4". range = b3_d4.Subtract(a1_b3) Debug.Assert(Not (range Is Nothing) And range.Address.Equals("$C$3:$D$3,$B$4:$D$4"))
' The union of B3:D4 and A1:B3 is "A1:B2,A3:D3,B4:D4". range = b3_d4.Union(a1_b3) Debug.Assert(Not (range Is Nothing) And range.Address.Equals("$A$1:$B$2,$A$3:$D$3,$B$4:$D$4"))
' The intersection of "A1,B1,A2,B2" and "A1:B1,A2:B2" is A1:B2. range = cells("A1,B1,A2,B2").Intersect(cells("A1:B1,A2:B2")) Debug.Assert(Not (range Is Nothing) And range.Address.Equals("$A$1:$B$2")) End Sub

member.param: Specifies the range to intersect with this range.

remarks.para: Note that the various workbook settings which make a workbook read-only in an end user workbookSet have no affect at this level.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Select
member.summary: Sets the current selection of the worksheet associated with the this range to the cells in this range.
member.remarks: The active cell is also set to the top-left cell of this range.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.IRange.Sort(SpreadsheetGear.SortOrientation,System.Boolean,SpreadsheetGear.SortKey[])
member.summary: Sorts the cells represented by this range according to the specified options.
member.param: Specifies whether to sort rows or columns.
