member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.CustomFunctions.Volatility
member.summary: Specifies the volatility of a custom function.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.CustomFunctions.Volatility.Invariant
member.summary: Specifies that a function always returns the same result for a given set of arguments.

remarks.para: Specifying Invariant provides a hint to the calculation engine which may be used in some cases to optimize calculation by caching results. Note that use of this hint is an implementation detail which has changed over time and is likely to change in the future.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.CustomFunctions.Volatility.VolatileEveryRecalc
member.summary: Specifies a volatile function which must be recalculated at least once every time the workbook set is recalculated or different arguments are passed to it.

remarks.para: Specifying VolatileEveryRecalc provides a hint to the calculation engine which may be used in some cases to optimize calculation by caching results. Note that use of this hint is an implementation detail which has changed over time and is likely to change in the future.

An example of a VolatileEveryRecalc function would be a function which returns the current date. Such a function should be recalculated each time a workbook set is recalculated, however, multiple instances of the function with the same arguments may just be calculated once during the calculation of a workbook set.
All cells containing VolatileEveryRecalc functions are marked as needing to be recalculated every time is called.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.CustomFunctions.Volatility.VolatileEveryInstance
member.summary: Specifies a volatile function which must be recalculated for every instance.

remarks.para: An example of a VolatileEveryInstance function would be a random number generator, which should return a unique random number for every instance in every formula.
All cells containing VolatileEveryInstance functions are marked as needing to be recalculated every time is called.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.Data.GetDataFlags
member.summary: Specifies options for the method.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.GetDataFlags.None
member.summary: Specifies default behaviour; not formatted text, first row does contain column headers, set column types from type of data in first row.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.GetDataFlags.FormattedText
member.summary: Return formatted text for all values instead of the raw floating point, logical, text and error values.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.GetDataFlags.NoColumnHeaders
member.summary: Specifies that the first row should not be treated as column headers (column names).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.GetDataFlags.NoColumnTypes
member.summary: Specifies that column types will not be set based on the data types of the first row of data;
member.remarks: This flag is ignored if FormattedText is set.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags
member.summary: Specifies options for the method.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.None
member.summary: Specifies default behaviour: automatically determine the best cell type and formatting; first row does receive column headers; do not insert cells to open space for the DataTable.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.AllText
member.summary: All values are stored and formatted as text, including numeric and boolean types which are converted to text.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.NoColumnHeaders
member.summary: Specifies that a row with column headers will not be created from the DataTable's column names.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.InsertCells
member.summary: Specifies that cells should be inserted to make room for the DataTable.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.WrapNoColumnHeaders
member.summary: Specifies that a row with column headers will not be created from the DataTable's column names when data wraps to a new worksheet.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.WrapToNewWorksheet
member.summary: Specifies that data will wrap to a new worksheet if it does not fit on the current worksheet; column headers will be placed at the top of this new worksheet unless SetDataFlags.WrapNoColumnHeaders is specified.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Data.SetDataFlags.WrapToNewWorksheet64K
member.summary: Specifies that data will wrap to a new worksheet if it does not fit in the first 65536 rows of the current worksheet; column headers will be placed at the top of this new worksheet unless SetDataFlags.WrapNoColumnHeaders is specified.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex
member.summary: Specifies a color scheme index for getting and setting theme colors on fonts and fills as well as accessing theme colors with ITheme.ColorScheme[ColorSchemeIndex index].
member.remarks: The Excel 2007 API sometimes incorrectly swaps Dark1 and Light1 as well as Dark2 and Light2. The SpreadsheetGear API correctly treates Dark1 as "Text 1", Light1 as "Background 1", Dark2 as "Text 2" and Light2 as "Background 2".

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.None
member.summary: Specifies that the represented color is not a theme color.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Text1
member.summary: Specifies the "Text 1" theme color which is also referred to as "Dark1" and defaults to System.Drawing.SystemColors.WindowText in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Background1
member.summary: Specifies the "Background 1" theme color which is also referred to as "Light1" and defaults to System.Drawing.SystemColors.Window in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Text2
member.summary: Specifies the "Text 2" theme color which is also referred to as "Dark2" and defaults to dark blue in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Background2
member.summary: Specifies the "Background 2" theme color which is also referred to as "Light2" and defaults to tan in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Accent1
member.summary: Specifies the "Accent1" theme color which defaults to pale blue in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Accent2
member.summary: Specifies the "Accent2" theme color which defaults to pale red in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Accent3
member.summary: Specifies the "Accent3" theme color which defaults to pale olive green in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Accent4
member.summary: Specifies the "Accent4" theme color which defaults to pale purple in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Accent5
member.summary: Specifies the "Accent5" theme color which defaults to pale aqua in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Accent6
member.summary: Specifies the "Accent6" theme color which defaults to pale orange in the default "Office" color scheme.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.Hyperlink
member.summary: Specifies the "Hyperlink" theme color.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ColorSchemeIndex.FollowedHyperlink
member.summary: Specifies the "FollowedHyperlink" theme color.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Themes.ThemeFont.None
member.summary: Specifies that
